description: Comprehensive water quality benchmark values from multiple regulatory and health-based sources

sources.name: California Industrial General Permit
sources.authority: California State Water Resources Control Board

sources.name: EPA National Primary Drinking Water Regulations
EPA Aquatic Life Criteria
sources.applicability: Surface water - protection of aquatic life

ANNUAL_NAL.name: Annual Numeric Action Level
ANNUAL_NAL.description: Average of all analytical results for a parameter from samples taken within a reporting year

MCL.name: Maximum Contaminant Level
MCL.description: Highest level of a contaminant allowed in drinking water; enforceable standard

ACTION_LEVEL.name: Action Level
ACTION_LEVEL.description: Concentration that triggers treatment or other requirements; not an MCL

CMC.name: Criteria Maximum Concentration
CMC.description: Acute aquatic life criterion (1-hour average concentration)

CCC.name: Criterion Continuous Concentration
CCC.description: Chronic aquatic life criterion (4-day average concentration)

SECONDARY_MCL.name: Secondary Maximum Contaminant Level
SECONDARY_MCL.description: Non-enforceable guideline for contaminants that may affect aesthetic quality

HEALTH_ADVISORY.name: Health Advisory Level
HEALTH_ADVISORY.description: Non-regulatory guidance value for contaminants without MCLs

METALS_HEAVY.name: Heavy Metals
METALS_HEAVY.description: Toxic metals with high atomic weight (lead, mercury, arsenic, cadmium)

METALS_TRACE.name: Trace Metals
METALS_TRACE.description: Metals present in small amounts (copper, zinc, iron, aluminum, nickel)
METALS_TRACE.healthConcerns: Essential nutrients at low levels; toxic at elevated concentrations

CONVENTIONAL.name: Conventional Pollutants
CONVENTIONAL.description: Common water quality parameters (TSS, BOD, COD, pH, turbidity)
CONVENTIONAL.healthConcerns: Water clarity, oxygen depletion, habitat degradation

ORGANICS_VOC.name: Volatile Organic Compounds
ORGANICS_VOC.description: Organic chemicals that easily evaporate (benzene, toluene, xylene)

OTHER.name: Other Parameters
OTHER.description: Parameters not classified in standard categories

hardnessDependentMetals.description: Metals whose toxicity varies with water hardness (calcium and magnesium concentration)
hardnessDependentMetals.rationale: Higher water hardness reduces the bioavailability and toxicity of certain metals to aquatic organisms

usageNotes.violationDetection: Compare sample results against applicable benchmarks based on water type and exposure timeframe
usageNotes.multipleThresholds: A single pollutant may have multiple applicable benchmarks (e.g., COPPER has IGP NAL, MCL Action Level, and aquatic CMC/CCC)
usageNotes.hardnessAdjustment: For hardness-dependent metals, calculate site-specific criteria using measured water hardness
usageNotes.unitConversion: Ensure sample results and benchmark units are consistent before comparison (mg/L vs Âµg/L)
usageNotes.levelStatus: California IGP facilities are assigned Level 1, 2, or 3 status based on NAL exceedances
usageNotes.pfasUpdates: EPA PFAS regulations finalized April 2024, with May 2025 updates pending; monitor for changes
usageNotes.cadmiumNote: 2016 chronic freshwater cadmium criterion was vacated in August 2023; use 2001 criterion
